decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to provide proof that the application property was not constructed before 1st July 1948 or after 28th October 2018. The application submission therefore fails to accord with Schedule 2, Part 1, Class AA.1. (c) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2020 (as amended).

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class AA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2020 (as amended) as the proposal, by reason of its siting, orientation relative to the bungalow, height and installation of third floor level windows on the rear elevation of the property would result in a detrimental impact on the residential amenity of The Bungalow, Charville Lane West, by reason of loss of privacy, overlooking and loss of light contrary to the requirements of Policies DMHB 11 and DMHD 1 of the Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and prior approval is refused under Condition AA.2.-(3)(a)(i).

The proposed development does not constitute permitted development by virtue of the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class AA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2020 (as amended) as the proposal, by reason of its siting, height, scale, bulk and design, would fail to harmonise with the character and architectural composition of the existing property and would subsequently be detrimental to the visual amenity of the street scene and harmful to the character and appearance of the surrounding area, contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012) and Policies DMHB 11 and DMHD 1 of the Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and prior approval is refused under Condition AA.2.-(3)(a)(ii).
